required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Computer Vision Based Approach vs. Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry Scan to Measure Body Fat Percentage
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of Computer Vision Based Approach vs. Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry Scan to Measure Body Fat

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to test whether a HealthReel computer vision-based software application can estimate body fat percentage with equivalent accuracy to a whole body dual energy x-ray absorptiometry scan.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is being done to test whether a computer vision-based software application can estimate body fat percentage with equivalent accuracy to a whole body dual energy x-ray absorptiometry scan. The dual energy x-ray absorptiometry scan involves lying on a machine for about 6-10 minutes. It is an open design. The study will also examine whether waist circumference measurement improves the accuracy of the body fat percentage estimate by the computer vision-based application.A total of approximately 492 subjects are planned to take part in this study at one study center.

primary_outcome.measure: variance in body fat percentage between computervision application and dexa scan
primary_outcome.description: Variance between body fat percentage measured by smart phone applicaiton compared to body fat percentage as measured by DEXA scan

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis will be undertaken to see if the variance between application and dual energy x-ray absorptiometry is reduced when the abdominal circumference is included in the application or whether inclusion of abdominal circumference does not reduce the variance.

arm_group.description: A 15 second long video will be obtained at the research site using a smart phone or tablet. Then subjects will undergo a whole body dual energy x-ray absorptiometry scan . Then the subject will go home and take a second 15 second long video. The videos will then be analyzed by computer based vision application and the body fat percentage measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry scan will be compared.

intervention.intervention_name: Computer based vision application by video
intervention.description: patients will be tested by computer based analysis of a video as well as by dexa scan.

intervention.intervention_name: whole body dual energy x-ray absorptiometry scan
intervention.description: subjects will receive a whole body dual energy x-ray absorptiometry scan to measure their body fat percentage

study_pop.textblock: Males and females between ages 18 and 100

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have the ability to provide informed consent before any trial-related activities
- Male or female, age > = 18 at time of signing informed consent
- Have access to and ability to use a smart phone to take a 15 second video from their home
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy at the time of screening
- Known osteoporosis with a T-score of <-2.5 at hip or spine or pathological fracture of spine
- Cirrhosis of the liver, or presence of ascites

eligibility.gender_description: Males and Females are eligible to participate, based on their biologic identity.
